details:
The exiv2 library is vulnerable to multiple issues that can all lead
to denial of service of the applications relying on the library to parse
images' metadata.


* [CVE-2017-11591](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11591)
Denial of service via floating point exception in
 the Exiv2::ValueType function.
* [CVE-2017-11683](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-11683)
Denial of service through failing assertion triggered by
 crafted image.
* [CVE-2017-14859](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-14859) /
 [CVE-2017-14862](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-14862) /
 [CVE-2017-14864](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2017-14864)
Denial of service through invalid memory access triggered by a crafted
 image.


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
0.23-1+deb7u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your exiv2 packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
